title: Command Discovery & Autocomplete
description: Implement a way for users to discover available commands (e.g., tab-completion, suggestions as they type, or a /list-commands command). Provide command usage hints and argument descriptions dynamically.

title: Richer Error Handling & Feedback
description: Standardize error responses with error codes and actionable suggestions. Log errors and user actions for better diagnostics and telemetry.

title: Contextual Awareness
description: Pass more context (e.g., active file, selection, workspace state) to command handlers for smarter responses. Allow commands to access previous chat history for multi-turn interactions.

title: Asynchronous/Streaming Output
description: Support streaming partial results for long-running commands (e.g., /query, /consult). Allow users to cancel or pause/resume long-running operations.

title: Extensibility
description: Enable dynamic registration/unregistration of chat commands at runtime (e.g., via plugins or user scripts). Support user-defined aliases or macros for frequently used command sequences.

title: Enhanced Help System
description: Provide detailed help for each command, including examples and related commands. Allow inline help (e.g., /help <command>) and context-sensitive tips.

title: User Experience
description: Add markdown formatting, code highlighting, and clickable links in chat responses. Support attachments or file uploads for commands that require file input.

title: Telemetry & Analytics
description: Track command usage, errors, and performance for continuous improvement. Provide users with analytics about their own usage (e.g., most used commands).

title: Multi-user/Collaboration Support
description: (If relevant) Allow multiple users to interact with the chat system in a shared workspace.

title: Testing & Robustness
description: Add more comprehensive automated tests for chat command dispatch, error cases, and edge scenarios. Ensure robust handling of backend restarts, timeouts, and partial failures.
